column1: They set out for the king's palace. When they were come thither
column2: Aylmer entrusted them to his steward
column4: whom he charged to bring them up in knightly ways. They were added to Aylmer's household
column5: and taught all that squires of kings should know. But Horn was to come to greater things than this. He learnt quickly
column6: and became beloved by every one; and most of all
column9: loved him from the day when she first set eyes on him. Her love for him grew daily stronger and stronger
column10: though she dared speak no word of it to him
column12: and he only a squire rescued by chance from the sea.At length Rimenhild could hide her love no longer.She sent for Athelbrus the steward
column13: and bade him bring Horn to her bower.
